movie_title: Why were there three popes at the same time? - Joëlle Rollo-Koster
introduction: Dig into the history of the Papal Schism, which caused a split in the Catholic Church while 3 popes
lead_intro: Learn about the intriguing history of the Great Schism of the Catholic Church and the struggle for papal power.

quiz.question: Who was the French King that raised taxes on the Church, leading to a conflict with Pope Boniface VIII?
quiz.explanation: King Philip IV of France raised taxes on the Church, leading to a conflict with Pope Boniface VIII.

quiz.question: Where did Pope Clement V move the seat of the papacy in 1309?
quiz.explanation: Pope Clement V moved the seat of the papacy to Avignon in 1309.

quiz.question: Who was elected as Pope after the death of the reigning Pope who returned to Italy in 1376?
quiz.explanation: After the death of the reigning Pope who returned to Italy in 1376, Pope Urban VI was elected.

quiz.question: What event in 1409 led to the rise of three popes in the Catholic Church?
quiz.explanation: The Council of Constance in 1409 led to the rise of three popes in the Catholic Church.

quiz.question: Who finally ended the Great Schism of the Catholic Church after 39 years?
quiz.explanation: Pope Martin V finally ended the Great Schism of the Catholic Church after 39 years by uniting the church.
